troubleshooting.title: Using Priming Rod with Warm Motor
troubleshooting.shortdesc: Guidance on proper usage of the priming rod when starting a warm motor, including recovery steps if engine flooding occurs.

condition.p: Motor is warm and needs to be started.

cause.p: Using the priming rod when the motor is warm can flood the engine with excess fuel, creating a mixture too rich to ignite properly.

step.cmd: Do not use the priming rod when starting a warm motor.
step.info: The carburetor typically doesn't require priming when warm.

step.cmd: Turn the carburetor adjusting needle clockwise (to the right) until it seats.
Turn the engine over several times.
step.info: This will help exhaust the overly rich gas mixture.

step.cmd: Once the motor starts, turn the needle counterclockwise (to the left).
Readjust the carburetor to proper settings.
